It's hands down, the most authentic Mexican meat in a corn thing in the Champaign-Urbana area - and I know my Mexican meats ;] Are they super fancy, foo foo, queso this, fajitas that? No - and that's the point.  If you want tacos and horchata, Maize is the place to go.  Just be ready to get friendly with some frat boys or take it to go.  Food: 5 Atmosphere: 4 Price: 4 Service: 5 Decor: 4  I discovered Maize my freshman year of college and was absolutely confused by the place - no place to eat and I ordered a torta ahogada (Mexican sandwich drowned in spicy red sauce).  But since then and for the last 5 years, I don't think I've gone more than 10 days on campus without going to Maize.  Oh the things I could delight on about Maize.  But I'll keep it short(er than usual).  Over the last few years, they've improved their salsas, bettered service (as much as is possible in a tiny hut), and increased prices (Facebook update moment, but of course, people still stick with and love it).  If you don't care about what kind of meat you put in your mouth or if you want your food doused in queso or sizzling or something, go elsewhere.  But if you want quality, authentic, no frills Mexican food, go to Maize.  Taco: $2.75 Taco Mexicana: $3.25 Tostada: $4 Horchata: $1.85  Tips: - on thicker, crunchier bases (tostada, sope), get chorizo or pastor; the juice/flavor will soak into the base and be that much better - try the gordita chicharron; "pork back" is basically just bacon; bacon taco? HOW not? - try a quesadilla with zucchini blossoms or huitlacoche, SO good  Oh and house-made corn tortillas and free freshly-fried chips.  None of that Tostito's looking, thin, straight out of the bag kinda' chips.  Leggo.

I have been in Champaign for two years. Having been raised in Los Angeles and lived in West Texas I've had a taste of many types of Mexican foods.   Maize is the real deal. Authentic, flavorful, and addictive. I love this place. It's not for those on a diet or looking for light substitutes--the plates are meaty, and sometimes greasy.   I have tried almost everything on their menu and everything is good. My favorite are the tacos Mexica--it's like a quesadilla taco. Amazing!

Probably the best Mexican place near campus. Order online or through phone beforehand to skip the wait. Dishes are very authentic and I'll come back once a month at least. Parking spots are limited, as well as dining space.

We tried the chicken and pork burritos. Both meats were salty, like they were shredded and mixed with Campbells soup. You get 2 sauces with your meal. The tomato looking one seems to me like a can of Rotel tomatoes, nothing else, very bland and watery. The brown/yellow sauce is very bitter and kind of an unpleasant color.  I ordered a side of guac, it was tasteless and the bottom of the bowl was full of lettuce so you dont get much. The only reason I can see that it would get high stars is because of the portion sizes, it is right by a college campus and a $6 burrito is huge.   I liked the bottles of cane sugar sodas. I liked the fresh lime wedges with my meal. The chips were good, seemed home made possibly.   I would never go back.

Unusual Mexican food, and not in a good way.  Low in spice and oddly sweet.  I've been twice and ordered different food.  The chips are okay.  The burrito was okay.  However, the Chile relleno special was not at all special.  I couldn't eat half my plate because they put avocado on it and I'm allergic, so I wouldn't be happy even if the rest of the food was good.  The Chile itself was adequate, though the filling seemed to be made with mashed potato (an innovation I didn't care for).  The beans tasted canned and the rice was sweet.  It was served with tortillas that were heavy and bland.  The atmosphere itself is a crowded little counter, so really a take out place.

The constant line of customers out the doors says it all - Maize has the best Mexican food! Every time I stopped by, I had to wait in line because this place is so popular. However, the wait is not too bad since so many people order to go and is totally worth it for the delicious food you will be enjoying after the wait.  The store itself is extremely tiny, so it is always quite crazy inside, with people eating, waiting and squeezing through to grab a seat. They serve free chips with two types of salsa and the food portions are very filling. Tacos seem to be a favorite among the customers but I have tried the burrito and torta which were both great.
The business owners and employees are awesome and fast. The horchata is delish. It's the best mexican in town. Just go there.

Ok, the FIRST time that I ate at this place it was ok.  But let me let you all know something a couple of months ago, I went into this lil box of a restaurant and ordered the 3 steak tacos like I ALWAYS get. Two hours later I was woke out of my sleep in excruciating pain and with PROJECTILE VOMIT!!!! I wound up in Carle Hospitals' emergency room with stomach cramps and nausea!!! They really messed me up! I will NEVVVVA EVVVVA eat at this place again. I really wanted to call a lawyer ANNND THE CU HEALTH DEPT. but I'll just settle for telling ANYONE WHO WILL LISTEN not to eat here UNLESS they're ready to DIE! BOOOOOO!!!

Best Mexican place around! The pastor burrito is a must. The best al pastor I've ever had. You have to stop here whether you're visiting U of I or passing along 74. Worth the detour for sure! Cheap and phenomenal cusine - always a winning combo.

OMG! I love Maize. My only sadness is that I can't eat wheat and corn right now - making Mexican food hard to stomach. But - the quesadlla with mushrooms and chicken! And the tlacoyo with pastor - the best! They're really fast and friendly. Highly recommend.

This is a small establishment with about 5 parking spots. There are about 16 counter seats.  We ordered Carne Asada and Fish Tacos (around $3 per) which were both tasty and not too greasy. We were recommended another open faced item on fried dough which was great as well. Chips and Salsa were offered as we waited for our tacos. The food was tasty/fresh, service was efficient, and overall a positive experience. Whoever was running the cashier was super patient, had a genuine smile, and was very calm even when it was busy (which seems like the line is always out the door). Can't wait to go back!
Great little Mexican place, best for take out.  Can't wait until they open the larger restaurant downtown.

One of the best Mexican restaurants I've had on campus. The service is great, fast, and efficient. The quesadillas are some of the best and the tacos are very filling. I love that you get chips and salsa with your order, especially the salsas they serve. One is a little spicy but then the other is not but also has a freshness to it. It's also great to see that there is a vegetarian/vegan menu for those who obviously don't or can't eat meat among other things. Definitely would recommend to lots of friends. Oh! And the prices are definitely not exaggerated. Every bite is worth it.

Tacos were phenomenal. (Got steak and pastor) both seasoned/marinated very well lots of flavor. Tortillas must be made in house or something. They were amazing. Gave the tacos a totally different flavor. Husband got a steak burrito also very good.

I ordered a burrito and the majority of it was lettuce, with barely any steak. At best, the rice, beans, and chips and salsa were average. Not sure why it is almost five stars. Average food, priced high.
Great for take out - ingredients so fresh you'd swear they were grown out back. I'd eat it every day if I could.
Never disappoints, the carne asada burrito is delicious. The service is fast and friendly. You probably should take it to go though, not much seating.

The food was pretty tasty but I feel the portions were really small for Mexican food. I know it's more authentic but I like the more Americanized Mexican food with bigger portions. I eat a lot so I don't know if that's why I don't get full but you can definitely get bigger portions elsewhere.
Just a great place to find a fine authentic meal at. I suggest ordering ahead of time!

A+ for any Mexican food enthusiast! good for vegetarians too. Their tacos and burritos are my favorite, they also have delicious tortas. Completely authentic food and they also have Jarritos to complement the delicious food.

I have had a lot of tacos, these are probably the best. The exterior leaves much to be desired and seating is nil, but the hassle is well worth the incredible food. I strongly recommend the chorizo sope and the guacamole.

MAIZE IS MUCHO RICO!! okay, I never pull the write-in-all-caps-to-make-a-point thing, but I felt it was necessary here. Maize would be the only exception. since they've opened i eat their food almost exclusively. I've never had something that wasn't short of an orgasmic experience. I feel like a perv eating there cuz the whole time I'm moaning and saying "this is sooo good!" And the people are really nice too! Really great customer service. Then environment is legit. and always clean. I've never had to complain about anything ever. and when i say "agua dehorchata with no ice please"...get this, they never ever put ice. WAHH? "Not even once?" you say--nope, not even once. The only thing is, that the place is rather small so I pick take-out over sit-in most of the time. But they are new and I guess they didn't realize how much success they'd have when they first started out. but I sure hope they expand soon!!
I expected MUCH more for the 4.5 stars.  Had asada flautas.  Below average at best.  Chips and salsa were average at best.  Sitting area is too small.  Would not return.
Got their asada (steak) burrito for $6.40 and medium horchata for $1.85. They give free chips/salsa for orders over $5.
Doesn't get any better than this in CU. Nothing fancy, nothing pretentious. Fantastic food.

So I've been twice now. The first time was crazy good, but I wanted to wait to write a review, just in case it was a fluke. It wasn't.  I just had the pastor (seasoned pork) burrito. Suddenly you feel like Chipotle is bland. This thing roars with lime and texture and spice. I had the spicy salsa--it's bright yellow and has layers of flavor. And the staff I've encountered are warm and quick to help.  This place looks like a hole in the wall on the corner of 1st and Green--I don't know what they're gonna do, but I hope this place is a permanent addition to Champaign and Campustown.
I ordered some traditional chorizo tacos. Really the best thing in the world. If you want some authentic Mexican food then this is the place.

Great new place. The food was very fresh and light, but incredibly filling. I got a chicken burrito, while my husband got two tacos and a chicken quesadilla (the tacos and quesadilla were small-ish, but made a great meal together).  Will definitely be back again! I think this may become a regular carry-out for us. Too small to go to with a group, but great as a grab-and-go meal.  As for the parking - I recommend using the meters across the street behind Domino's. Waaaaay easier to get in and out of than the tiny parking lot by the restaurant.

Excellent food, excellent value. Favorite Mexican place. Order huaraches with chorizo and you won't be disappointed. My bf likes the corn fungus in a fried quesadilla - I'll pass. Chips are various salsas are also delicious and different. The only downside is that it's small and can be crowded, but it's worth the wait!  To the people comparing this place to El Toro and Dos Reales - really? You've go to be kidding.   The chicken tacos are a little bland, I will say that.

You know you've found a good deal when you see undergrads lined up out the door.  I don't know how this place turns a profit at the prices they charge.  I got two items, both under $3 each, and they gave free chips and salsa (good and spicy salsa at that) with my order.  Their chorizo is excellent and all the ingredients tasted really fresh.  It's impressive seeing the waitstaff team go to work during rush hour, running with the speed, friendliness and efficiency of a championship McDonalds staff.
You know what I really wanted to like this place because of the hype. Decided to try a torta never had one tried it. Well it was awful I will give them another chance but it will be a while.

this is very good food at a great price; the girls behind the counter are very nice and help you with any questions you may have about the menu...if you love cilantro and lime you will be in heaven.  Tiny dining space...but I fit at the counter..yeah

This place is delicious and the service is quick. Only downsides are that seating is limited and cramped, and also the vegetarian options are less than impressive.  While I was eating meat though, this place was a favorite.

Really good and crowded! Unless you're getting here really early don't plan to eat at the place.  I don't know much about authentic mexican food so take this with a grain of salt but enjoyed the food. I could taste how fresh everything was. It was a good find.   P.S.- lots of construction right now so parking is crazy.
Best Mexican food in Champaign. Great service and price. Usually very busy on the weekend so weekdays are best for speedy service. Love this on campus gem.

Fantastic. I got the chicken flautas which came with rice and beans. They were covered in sour cream and queso fresco and had a side of guacamole and Pico de gallo too. My friend got an Asada burrito I think and she enjoyed it a lot too. Will definitely come back.

Anything you get here is great. Really. I always tend towards the pastor because I am a pork fan, but the chicken or steak are all great too. Whenever someone visits me from out of town, the two places I take them to eat are here and Black Dog.    The only person I have ever known who doesn't like Maize was one of my old roommates... but he also used to put ketchup and cheese on bread and call it a meal, so take that with a grain (or heaping mound) of salt.

Finally, finally, finally after years of trying mediocre fiestas, toros, haciendas, and even chipoltes---there is finally a place in Champaign-Urbana to get delicious tacos. Amazing corn tortillas made daily, fresh ingredients, chile de arbol, and salsa de molcajete  are more than enough reason to support this business.   In addition to the food (I had the fish tacos--a bargain at $2.75 and the most expensive taco on the menu), the staff was super friendly and the 6-stool eatery made for an informal yet enjoyable dining experience. Check it out, you won't be disappointed!

Yittty bitty!  I celebrated my 37th birthday, here, with my husband, and baby sister!  It was asses-to-elbows at the countertop, but the food was fantastic.  Service was a little slow, but the chips and salsa kept coming, and the company was great, so it didn't much matter.  The long and short of it is this, however-- five years later, and I still haven't been back.  The food was _fine_, but I didn't quite see the reason for all the hype.  I mean, Dos or Escobars... plenty of other fish in the sea.  Still, a fine spot for a quick bite.
Nothing is better than a fish taco from maize! I seriously crave them! You can't go wrong w any of the tacos honestly.
Consistent quality, tasty Mexican food at a reasonable price. One of the best options in town for Mexican.

What this place lacks in size (it's tiny, but in the best way) it makes up for in AMAZING food. Though you might have to wait a while to order-it's definitely a popular place on campus-the food is totally worth it.  You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu, and and you gotta love the homemade chips and salsa. And don't forget the guac, oh the guac! It's a must order.  My advice: make some time and give this wonderful place a chance. You won't be disappointed.

All was very good had the burrito with Kearny Asada and a taco with  pastor both needed more meat but what they gave was very good.  The Home made chips and salsa were the bomb! Very nice wait staff very friendly.

Came to this place for the first time and let me tell you the food was delicious and fast! What sold me was the handmade tortillas can't go wrong with that on a taco. Overall this place is worth it! If you're craving Mexican homemade food

Does this place even need another raving review?? Yes, of course, because it is that good. I have never had corn tortillas this amazing in my life. I love this restaurant, and I want one of their t-shirts so I can walk around and advertise for them. Fantastic food, can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Go!! Eat at Maize!!

Just passing through on our way from WI to Indy, we stopped because of the positive yelp reviews and we were trying to make time on our trip.    A few things stand out:  1.). Yes the place is small...however we found seating as soon as we ordered as the turnover was quick +1  2.). The staff was very friendly +1  3.). Chips and salsa were delivered almost instantly (and free) when we sat down and noticed that's the standard here.  The chips were firm and thick, solid combo with the spicy two salsas they served +2  4.).  Prices and food both good, bordering on great! +1 (I had the burrito and a taco americano with chorizo, the burrito was delish and would have been enough by itself )  5.). Speed - we were in and out in 20-30 mins
Delightfully filling with quality ingredients. Extremely quick service and low price. I HIGHLY recommend eating here!!

Maize will always be my go to spot in Champaign-Urbana. I have so many memories here. The food here reminds me of the food in Chicago and it has a very homey feeling. It's close to campus. The food is delicious, authentic, and cheap. I always get burritos, tostadas, sopes, tacos, or tortas. It's a small place and gets very packed, but they run the business very efficiently and fast. You will get your food almost immediately.

Best Mexican food at UIUC in my opinion.  It's cheap, tasty, and has good authenticity.  All of the employees are super friendly and good at their jobs--the food is made fresh and comes out as quickly as it can.  It does get really crowded sometimes (it's a small restaurant that seats maybe 15 people) but turnaround time is quick so that's never been much of a problem.  I'd definitely recommend stopping by!

Delicious authentic Mexican food.  Small area for seating. Restaurant gets crowded around meal times but food never takes longer than 10 minutes to pick up.   Most of their business is carry out and parking is limited.  Awesome for UIUC students.

By far...the best tacos and salsa in the Midwest. There is not a taquiera that can compare in the region. Only comparable taco stands are san loco in Miami Beach and Tacos Locos in Brooklyn. This is a legendary taco stand that should take you way out of your way to try. I would go so far as to say, stay a night in Champaign so you can hit Maize once...or maybe even twice, during your visit!

Died and gone to Mexican Food Heaven! They must have angels in the kitchen cooking for the food to be as good as it is!  The guacamole is a gift from on high and when you add it to ANY of their dishes-it elevates already perfect food to sublime.  The Devil is in the details and those details include the freshest ingredients, friendly and efficient front staff, great variety on the menu, and the best Mexican food I've ever had in my long lived life-and I am a Mexican food fiend. Now, if I could get them to set up in Atlanta, I really would be in heaven!

Don't get me wrong, the food here is really good, but I just don't think it's amazing like everyone talks about. The guacamole was awesome, but a little pricey in my opinion. Granted, you get a ton of it. Overall, I thought the food was pretty good but didn't live up to the hype.

Problem 1: This Mexican restaurant did not have melted queso  Problem 2: Very inconsiderate to mistakes made on off menu dish prices.  Problem 3: Doesn't have Chicken, cheese and rice, or normal flavored margaritas- like come on.   It's a no from me.

3 and 1/2 stars Volcan is the bomb- I love the steak volcan but my husband swears by the volcan pastor. We don't live in Urbana anymore but we always make sure we come get their volcan if we are in town. My husband gets volcan pastor, and I get their steak volcan. Both are perfect, along with their chips and salsa - especially the habanero salsa (yellow one). Pro tip- the habanero salsa is very very hot and should be ingested with caution.  I gave only 3 and 1/2 stars because the entrees are not impressive, and seems a little scanty on quantity- given that we are used to huge portions in the usual mexican fare at all other places we have been to. I recommend the volcan- it's cheap, filling, and delicious!

Authentic and tasty, no question. Enjoyed a burrito con al pastor, which had that lively, slightly sweet flavor. It was excellent and plenty large. The salsa is clearly made in house and is also delicious (and comes with the meal, I might add). As good as Mexican gets in CU. Here's to hoping the steady volume of traffic I've noted driving by (and visiting the once) continues.

I absolutely love this place. Best Mexican food in CU hands down. I order the chips an guacamole to start, and then the chicken fajitas as an entree. The portions are huge and I had enough for 2 meals. The food was so satisfying and delicious. My boyfriend and I got lucky and actually got a seat at the window, but I always carry out. Their horhata is also very delicious, I come here all the time.

Loved the food, begging from Cali it almost felt like I was home in SanPedro or LA getting a good burrito. It's really some so it makes it hard to be comfortable but it makes you get speedy service and eat and go no lingering around.
Great food!  Love the guac and hot salsa.  I wish they could get more parking spaces, and hopefully they get that other location open soon!

This was a recommendation by a recent U of I graduate. If she learned nothing else in college, she learned where the good places to eat are located.  We got to Maize about 5 minutes before they opened. The staff was eating and the door was still locked. While we waited,  a line began to form. The door opened and the line kept on going all day long. We had tacos, nachos and a burrito. All excellent. Staff was pleasant and helpful. It is not fancy and it is all counter seats, but Maize is a very worthwhile stop.   Limited free parking.
Awesome Mexican food! Would recommend tortas and fish quesidilla for sure. The place is small though, so taking out parcel is suggested.

My favorite food on campus. It's close by my apartment, so I get it all of the time.   My personal favorite is the carne asada, it's easily the best meat they have.   Make sure you ask for mild or hot salsa with your chips, otherwise they give you a random one. If you're like me and you don't like hot salsa, that can be an issue.

Maize, what can I say about you? It was love at first bite.  This is authentic Mexican food in Champaign. The chicken, fish, and ground beef burritos are amazing. The ground beef, chicken, and chorizo tacos are great. The volcano taco is fantastic. Catch my drift? And free chips with any order...what more could you ask for?  Well if you want to get specific, my only complaint would be that the place is small and so is the parking lot (5 spots maybe?). It's always crowded, but always worth the wait. Call and place your order in advance so you can skip the line.

Food here is good! I have tried different items and have always liked it. It's one of the few good Mexican restaurants in the area.   However, the place is just too cramp. There's barely any space to move around and definitely no personal space during busy hours. It's only good for take out.
As good as Mexican food gets in Champaign! I like the al pastor and steak tacos. There torta is also delicious! Oh and the salsas are great! Best horchata in town too!

Forget campus town, this is my favorite food spot in the entire C-U area. Killer good food at a fair price. The lines do get long, it might take a while to have a couple of seats open up, and you might have to park in a meter lot across the street, but the food is so so worth it. Miss Champaign, and miss Maize!

This place is top-notch for takeout! The pastor is among the best I've ever had. The seating inside is too cramped for me so dining in isn't great. I like to take my food to a downtown bar to enjoy a beer with my tacos.
There steak taco was good,but I wish that didn't put cabbage in the lettuce because I don't like cabbage. I like there chips and salas.  I wish they low there prices.

This is mexican food like you would find IN Mexico, not here.  And that alone makes it a few notches above everyone else.  There is a lot on the menu i'd like to try, but the tacos mexicano are hard to pass!

I still love this place, despite the cramped seating area!  I love their chips and salsas.  Their guacamole is great!   I LOVE their fish tacos --- I order them overtime.... and they even made me a fish burrito once as well.... that was also great!   I don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu here.... yes, the restaurant is small, but it's a real bang for your buck.
Great price for some really good authentic-tasting food

Tried the queso dip and Asada tacos. Never had queso like this before and didn't really know how to eat it. We ate it with chips and put some into the tacos. It is not gooey enough so I would pass on getting it again. Tiny shop with a handful of seats. Pretty good Mexican food for the area.

By far the best Mexican food I've ever eaten (and I lived in the East Bay for nearly a decade).  It's gotten to the point that I'm seriously considering faking a pregnancy to justify how often and how much I eat at Maize.  When I leave Illinois in the near future, this will be the only thing I miss.  I actually cried the other day thinking about losing it.

With so many other reviews, I'll explain shortly why I like this place:  -(Seemingly) fresh ingredients -Friendly staff that give prompt and thorough service -Delicious Horchata -Light and heavy options

After reading all the rave reviews I had to check Maize out and finally this past week I had a chance.  I ordered for take-out, knowing that it would probably be packed and when I got there it was indeed filled with people.   I ordered a handful of items for me and my roommate.  I got a rib-eye taco, a chorizotaco, and a pastor taco.  The rib-eye was thinly sliced and was of good quality.  The grilling gave it a little bit of char and was tasty.  I did feel that it was a bit underseasoned and could have used a touch more salt.  The chorizo taco had your standard ground chorizo, but was delicious.  The pastor taco was the best of the three, great flavor and a touch of heat.  As others have mentioned the tortillas are handmade and they're fantastic.  A bit chewier than your typical store bought tortilla and adds an element of texture to their dishes.  My roommate got a fish taco, a carne asada taco, and a grilled chicken quesadilla.  He seemed to enjoy everything as well, but don't have much commentary beyond that.     Definitely a place worth visiting regularly, seeing that their prices are low and the food is great.
One of the best places to eat in Champaign. They have a great value for their food! My favorites are the burritos and the chips are delicious.

I was here a few weeks ago, looking for some lunch between meetings, and we decided that Maize was the perfect fit. It's interesting, local, affordable, and quite possibly the perfect lil' lunch stop in Champaign.  Here's what you need to know: this place is teeny. Tiny. Since I've only been once, I can't say for sure, but my hunch is that during peak hours it can be tough to find a place to sit. There are only a handful of seats in the place to begin with, but with the rush I saw on weekday at lunch, I was darn lucky to grab a few seats at the counter that attaches to the wall, looking out.  Cramped quarters notwithstanding (and truthfully, they sorta add to the charm), there's plenty to like. To my surprise, they actually bring out some chips and salsa, and it's a real plate kind of place. I thought that with its small size, you'd just see things served in paper trays or wrapped in paper. But I like the hospitality of real dishes and the extra nibbles while you wait for your food.  Even though the menu looks familiar--you've got your burritos and tacos and quesadillas--it's not the same ol' Americanized stuff. No, it's got some creativity to it. It's got some food service sensibility to it. Where else can you find squash blossom or huitlacoche quesadillas? Oh, and get the latter. Darn good. I'm not terribly familiar with different regions of Mexico, but the food here struck a chord as being tied more to Mexico, D.F., than say, something more provincial. I'm out on a limb exposing my ignorance, but that's my timid notion.  My burrito was the bizness. Not overly stuffed and the size of an infant, but rather, reasonably portioned, full of flavor, and still plenty of layers so it didn't become monotonous munching. I opted for pastor, but they've got other choices for meat, or you can go meatless.  You can probably go back a few times and it feels interesting. The menu is varied enough to be interesting and enticing, but not to overly wrought so they can't focus. They keep it simple, but save a few tricks for the observant orderer.

I am a taco snob! I am fully aware, but this place absolutely lives up to my expectations. I spent the majority of my 20's in Southern Cali so I've definitely done my research when it comes to tacos. The tortillas are made fresh in the kitchen, the meat is well seasoned and the toppings are perfect! I love the Lomo Mexica (not on the menu) which is basically the grilled cheese rib-eye taco. Yasss honey! The steak, fish, pork and chicken are great too (in that order) I have also tried their sopes which are totally yummy, but the tacos are definitely the main event! Stop by when you have time and patience to deal with the lines and limited seating. If I had to state one downside it would be the chips which are nothing to rave about but hey this place is A1!

I didnt think that I would find a mexican food place that is this great on my college campus. I have been there many times and havent been disappointed once. The food is great. The service is great, they know everything there is to know about their food and they are great at helping you choose your meal. Service is fast. If you are ever in champaign, Maize is a must.
Very small and cozy place with really nice staff. Food was great and reasonably priced. Good place to stop for a quick bite.

this place is a hidden gem in champaign. arguably the best mexican food in town. salsa is awesome and tortas are just right. i haven't gotten anything that has tasted bad there.  parking is quite difficult during peak hours, but it makes the atmosphere that much better.

Very inexpensive and delicious Mexican food. I had the Vegetarian Taco for lunch, at a mere $2.50, and it was perfect. The line was going out the door, and the seating was limited, but it was a nice day so people could sit outside. I'd imagine they keep the prices low by sticking with a small, cozy space with plenty of character.
Yes, Authentic Mexican food that is oh so affordable. They even have pumpkin flower and huitlacoche tlacoyos. Try them and you won't regret it!

It's small and quaint, but it's so good! I get the veggie burrito and it's quite large but doesn't over fill me. They also give you tortillas and salsa with every purchase, pretty nice addition. The salsa is definitely on the spicy side but it's great.   It doesn't take long to get your food either, very quick.
Every time I order from here I try and get something different.  Each and every single thing I have had is definitely amazing.  Real authentic mexican food!
Very good tacos - fish steak and chicken all fantastic. Cute Cosy crowded interior but lots of character. Loved it!

This place is awesome, I either get the tacos asada or the asada flautas... which are delicious, crunchy, and not drenched in oil! These are the only tacos on campus that I don't have to drench in lime because they are so tasty on their own. Their salsas are great too, with actual heat!

Seriously loved this place! I went for lunch last week while I was visiting a friend at U of I - so glad she suggested it!   I got chicken tacos and they came with complimentary chips - love that, although I could've used a little more salsa. Since it was free, I can't complain. Tacos were SO GOOD. Very Mexican-street-food kind of tacos. yum yum yum! She got a torta which she said she's had before and loves. This will definitely be a regular place to hit up when I am visiting U of I!  Only downside was that we planned on eating there but it was packed so we ended up getting our food to go. Not a huge deal at all

This place saved me. I struggled to find a good authentic Mexican restaurant near campus. The burritos and tacos are outstanding, and the presentation - complete with lime wedges and two types of salsa - makes for a wonderful experience. There is not much seating, but if you order and wait a moment you're sure to find a spot at the counter or at the window.

My review is not necessary here. You've read the other 300 reviews which rave about this place, and rightfully so. It's surprising to be able to get such great, quality and authentic Mexican tacos and sopes in my beloved hometown in the corn belt, but here it is, in all its glory. The homemade corn tortillas are wonderful. At the end of the day, all I ever really want is a mouthful of masa and salsa. This place delivers. The only thing wrong with Maize is they haven't opened a second location yet.

Been a fan since they first opened. Generally friendly, fast service--including from the owner. Of course it's probably the best "Mexican" in town, although the burritos and tacos (meat) can be a bit on the saltier side. Wonder if they'll ever get a more appealing sign though (and not just a flimsy banner?)
This place totally lives up to the hype. It's awesome Mexican food and the price can't be beat.

Mexican street food, but phenomenal.  I ordered a huarache and horchata. I meant to order a tlacoyo, but something got lost in the translation; nonetheless, the single huarache was enough to satisfy my lunch needs.  The horchata was, as I recall, more cinnamony than sweet and overall a great drink. The huarache, however; that was something else. It was the best toppings of any taco I've ever had, with nice, crumbly cotija cheese, crunchy lettuce, and well-cooked steak (I think) al pastor. It was served on top of something that resembled a thick, fried tortilla, and the combination of textures and flavors worked very, very well.   The chips went to my wife, who, because the store has about 15 seats total, was on the other side of the restaurant. Nonetheless I was able to try chips with the various salsas, all of which were very good.  This place is a gift to Champaign, and if you're traveling anywhere near town, you owe it to yourself to give it a try.

one word.. TACOS. Maize has the the best tacos in town, in my opinion. The venue is reeeeally small, but that doesn't take away from the food they offer. Their pulled chicken that they have on their tacos is to die for. Writing this review right now is making me want to eat a taco from here, wow.   SO delicious! Plus it's affordable. Highly recommend.

This is a little hidden gem with the best Mexican food in town.  The place is very small and cramped, and there is often a line out the door.  However, the tacos de carne asada (steak tacos) are to die for - made with corn tortillas, cilantro and onions, just the way they are supposed to be.  The burritos are passable, but stick with the tacos if you want rather authentic Mexican food.  The price is not the cheapest compared to say, Dos Reales (another decent Mexican place in town), you do not get any sides and the drinks do not come with refills.  However, it is definitely more authentic.    Dining in at this place might feel rushed since it is so small - best get your food to go.
Excellent food and great staff. Small space to eat, but the chips and salsa make it an ideal place in Champaign!  I had the chicken and carne asada tacos and they were great!

I'll start by saying I'm a foodie snob; I choose carefully and wisely about food options- and I love my local businesses. I decided on a Friday evening to first give Maize a try- bad decision, floods of people waiting in the rain and a frat party. On Saturday I tried again around late noon, just a small line outside the door. Previously, I thought the task would be getting into Maize and ordering- think again, it's actually finding parking, then maneuvering into a spot or parking stalking. On this occasion I did all the above whilst driving, during rush hour and graduation...All for good reason.   THIS STUFF IS THE BIZNOMB FORRIZEAL, holy guacamole, pass the salsa, slap my momma and sit down- if you're standing up! As soon as I bit into a chip the stress of traffic from the U of I graduation began to fade, even as mini van mom almost took me out in traffic...no worries though. There's Breaking Bad and Breaking Tacos- I prefer the latter, with well seasoned cooked carne asada, fresh guacamole and pico de gallo- the drive home was so delicious! Were there fireworks? Did my foot pop à la Princess Diaries? I believe so. Either way I'm very happy that I'm athletic because this could easily make a chiquita, gordita... Ain't nothing wrong with a little extra topping though.  Bottom line (literally) If you like authentic Mexican food outside of Chicago then vámanos! This restaurant is THE champagne of Champaign and perhaps the Midwest region.

I finally got around to trying this place, and I'm really glad I did. It was the best steak burrito I've had in town, cheap prices, and they had Mexican coke which is delicious.  Just a killer place and has become a regular spot to pick up dinner for me and my lady.

I went here last weekend after trying, unsuccessfully, to get fed at two other places. Apparently everyone else had the same idea we did going to Black Dog at 2:30 on a Saturday; I was saddened, but not really surprised by the prohibitively long line there. Then at Golden Harbor, we stood at the counter for fifteen minutes while countless wait/kitchen staff walked past us without acknowledging us. Disappointed in two of my favorite restaurants, we shuffled off to try Maize. First of all, for such cramped quarters, service was really great. The waitress was prompt and friendly -- even though my standards may have been a bit lowered by circumstance, it was still more than I would expect from a hole-in-the-wall place like this. The food was outstanding. Excellent queso fundido, and the torta ahogada was delicious, if impossible to eat without a fork. I'll definitely be going back, even if I can get service elsewhere!

it's a great place to go, whether it's for tacos, chips and guac, or simply to tell a mere racist joke in front of other customers to make them uncomfortable. I used to get volcanes 4x a week here, chorizo and al pastor were my favorite. Better than anything else on the menu.  Caution- the salsas are really spicy. The torta ahogada is extremely spicy.
Great quesadillas but need to add more meat to tortas and burritos especially for the prices!
Great food but not much room for dining in. Definitely a great option for carryout. Service is great. The employees are very friendly. You can't go wrong ordering anything on the menu!

From 11am to 9 pm, Maize is where I go for my Mexican cravings all year. Maize is a small gem located at the intersection of Green Street and 1st Street on UIUC's campus.   Maize has limited seating with seats for up to about 15 people inside. They have two picnic benches outside that allow people to eat in warm weather. I love eating inside and out because I can see everyone go by on Green Street.   Peak hours are the usual eating hours: 12 and 5:30/6 pm. The line can get so long that it wraps around the building. When you get your receipt, it will have a number printed at the top that they call out if they are busy. The line moves pretty quickly if it is busy and it doesn't seem like a long wait at all.   The menu is simple but extensive. They have items that everyone is familiar with (tacos, burritos, quesidillas) and lesser known items (Gordita, Sope, Huarache). Basically everything at Maize involves some type of tortilla and some type of meat. They factor that differentiates them all is the way they are prepared. The staff is extremely helpful when explaining and giving recommendations. They tell you exactly how it is prepared and how big it is.   My favorite meat to order is the chorizo because not many Mexican restaurants have it and it has a bit of a kick to it! They also have pastor, chicken, and beef. There is a vegetarian option that consists of rice and beans. The chips, guacamole, and salsa are all fresh and are worth every penny. If you eat inside, you can ask for another bowl of chips and they won't mind at all. You also have to ask for silverware if you have take out. They will give you one of the packages with a napkin, fork, and a knife.   Maize has several drink options. You can request a water cup or you can enjoy some sweet Horchata or Jarritos, a Mexican soda.   Maize is as expensive or inexpensive as you would like. One taco with chips can be satisfying and will only be around $4 with tax. But with extras (drink, guac, multiple tacos), the price can add up. Personally, if I know I want guacamole one day, I will order a cheaper item. If I order a burrito, I won't order guac or a drink because the burritos are very filling.  If you don't have time or the money to go to Mexico, Maize is an excellent replacement.

Everyone raves about Maize and it's mostly true. I always get their largest size Horchata and a couple items off the menu. Great variety and taste.   Note that the food is pretty gross when not warm. Like, usually food is okay if it's not hot/warm, but for some reason Maize just doesn't taste anywhere close to as good. This can be a problem if you're ordering takeout and need to walk back to your residence.  Inside is a little cramped, with a bunch of neatly arranged barstools for cozy seating. There are also 2 tables outside for when it's warmer.

Great prices, tasty food and decent service for such a small little building and staff. Bilingual, too, which is great. They were good about bringing chips and a drink while I waited only about 5 minutes for my meal.

There's no wonder this place is the highest rated restaurant in CU. It would still get a 4.5 star in a city with quality mid-range restaurants. The food was great. After living in Mexico City for 2 years, I got pretty attached to my Pastor meat and they do it pretty well. I got a taco and quesadilla al pastor. The flavor is pretty concentrated like I like it, but it was a bit much for my wife (she got a tostada w/ Pastor). The Quesadilla was quite filling, surprisingly. And if you swapped out tortillas it would just be a Gringa. Only suggestion for improvement... add Pina to the Pastor to balance flavors. The carne asada is highly recommended here and by folks in the restaurant and it is actually pretty close to what you'd find on the streets of D.F. In all honesty, if you're visiting and only have one place to visit in town, drop in for some quality Mexican food.  Terrible parking situation. Try to avoid normal busy times cause the restaurant is tiny with limited seating and parking. So, take a stroll to avoid parking issues and take the food to go and head to the park just a street north to wander around the beautiful pond and man-made waterfalls.
So good and so unique. Yes, it's tiny, but that's something cool about it. I've even gone there for a quick casual dinner with my husband and sat on the stools.

I've experienced Maize 3 times now, so I feel like nothing can be chalked up to just bad luck at this point.  I've had the tacos all 3 times. Carne asada. Sadly, just not good (I know, I should've tried something else...). Meat is dry, served in a relatively small soft tortilla with a bed of mostly cilantro and some onions. Rice is a bit dry as well. Chips and salsa are free with every order. Hard to complain about free, but... I'll try. The chips are okay, but the salsa is basically bland tomato water with some tomato chunks. The guac here is good though. 2 tacos cost almost $5; too expensive for me considering I'm still hungry afterwards.  This might be an issue only with takeout though, as the food I received looks different from the images here of food that was dine-in.  Service was great. Everyone I interacted with on the staff was very nice and friendly. Food took just about 2 or 3 minutes from ordering to get to my hands.  Be prepared to get it takeout, as seating is very minimal here, 12-15 people max at any time.  Random fact: 2 of the 3 times I had Maize was at a Yelp tech talk.
This is honestly the best Mexican in C-U. The ingredients are always fresh, staff is incredibly nice, & the price point is super affordable for quality food.
I am adding a couple stars because of the wonderful job they do catering events. They are understanding of your needs, and the payment system is very convenient.

This place has excellent food and service. The people working there are responsive and the service is quick. It is definitely one of the best places to get Mexican food in the area. The food is top-tier, nicely prepared, and authentic. Definitely try the chalupa...fried!  However, the dining area is small so I would suggest going on off hours.

Great food. Fast. All scratch made. The al pastor has great flavor and is unusually moist. Excellent tortillas. Great selection. Crazy busy. If you like mushrooms, take the leap and order the huitlacoche.

This is a great place if you're in the mood for Mexican, but don't have the time or money to go sit down or go to chipotle. It is a lot better if you get to eat it at the restaurant, but to-go will be a good enough fix. It's not the best mexican food ever, but it gets the job done.

This place is amazing!   We were driving through Illinois on our way to Wisconsin and read some positive yelp reviews and decided to try Mexican for lunch!  Yes, it is very small and you need to wait your turn for seating, but the turnover was quick and once we sat down we got our drinks and free chips and salsa immediately (great chips and two sauces).  My husband ordered the carne asada torta ahogada. And it was huge and he said the special spicy sauce was perfect: hot AND tons of flavor. He also ordered the chalupas. There were actually three per plate-it was probably the best shaved pork I've ever had. Either of those dishes alone would have made a substantial size lunch. I ordered the chicken gordita (I think it was supposed to come with beans, but I'm glad it didn't, the chicken was so flavorful and enough on it's own). Lastly (I know we were pigs today!) we had a beef volcane. The volcane was probably our least favorite, but the tortilla it was on, and the cheese it was covered in, were delicious (not soggy at all).  Highly recommend for a low-key, cheap, fun, filling meal!
The closest taste of Mexico at Urbana-Champaign area. Delicious and reasonable priced!

Updating my review because ever since Maize temporarily closed the Green St. location and opened up at Chestnut, the food quality has definitely gone down. I've had it 3-4 times in the past 3 months and have gotten really sick every time. Definitely not worth paying for if you can't even enjoy your meal.

I came here for lunch on Friday.  It was pretty quiet- only a couple other people eating.  I had the chicken quesadilla and what was supposed to be a carne asada taco with no onions.  Prices were fairly low and the food came rather quickly.  First off, they messed up my order as the taco wasn't carne asada.  Then when I sent it back and it returned, the meat was carne asada, but was covered in onions.  By this point, I was over it, so I didn't bother to send it back a third time- just didn't eat it.    I was expecting more from this place because of all of the rave reviews.  To be honest, my quesadilla was really oily (on the outside!) and extremely bland. It was missing heat, spice, anything to liven up the taste.    Overall, I wasn't too impressed and doubt I'll be back. It just wasn't all that.

Although a tad far from campus, this place has great classic Mexican dishes. The restaurant itself doesn't have much room to sit so keep that in mind. I always take a steak burrito or tacos to go and eat at my apartment! There isn't much flavor to the meat I'll be honest, but the quality of the ingredients are nice and fresh.

Good hole-in-the-wall style decent Mexican food. It's very small and cozy, just two rows of counter seating facing away from each other with a little aisle in between, but they bring your food to you. I think there is some outdoor seating too. There's a really small parking lot and street parking nearby. I had a big burrito that was only $5, but it was almost entirely lettuce. There was hardly any meat in it and it didn't taste like much. But like I said, $5. My friend had a quesadilla which was good. The chips and salsa and guac are really good, and the staff is really nice!

Maize is my favorite restaurant ever. The tacos are even better than tacos in Los Angeles. Try the tomatillo salsa. It's heavenly. Unfortunately, I no longer live in Champaign, so I can't eat there every day. Man, what I wouldn't do for that tomatillo recipe.   I LOVE YOU, MAIZE!

Maize is closer to a fine restaurant than a storefront. This would be one of the top 5 Mexican places in Chicago, even.  Everything is seared to a crust, exactly how it's supposed to be. Masa is pressed to order as sopes, tacos, huerachas, etc. Ingredients are generously applied, almost absurdly so. They have two salsas, and both are excellent complements to their recipes. Prices are low, you can eat like a king for under $10. Food comes out quick, in less than 10 minutes.  Most of all, everything tastes phenomenal. This is a special place and I hope UIUC appreciates it.

Maize is by far my favorite place on campus to get Mexican food! They always give you complimentary chips and salsa to go along with your meal. The portions themselves are very reasonable for the price. Although seating is limited, it's definitely worth the visit!

I love nearly everything I've tried at Maize, but I find myself nearly always eating my favorite: chicken flautas. They're served with guacamole, rice, beans, and pico de gallo and topped with sour cream and crumbly cheese.   I did find the burrito to be pretty meh and on occasion their service can be lackluster but for the most part I really like coming here.   The new restaurant is great though I miss going to the First St location that will hopefully reopen soon.

Best Mexican food I have ever had in my life! Very authentic. I would find myself eating here several times a week and I never got sick of it. They need to get a bigger restaurant though so more people can dine in.

Maize is my go-to for quality Mexican food in the Champaign area. Aside from the fantastic steak burrito (which I get every time) the atmosphere is vibrant and fun. It's a cozy place with only about 15 seats, but if you get a chance to dine in, the service is awesome and the environment is welcoming. The to-go service is great too; very quick and simple.   Overall, I love this place, and it will always hold a special place in my heart.

If Yelp had a 1/2 star this would get an extra half to a 4.5  While driving through Illinois i had a taste for Mexican food, Jumped on yelp and found this gem. Once i arrived i found the parking to be small, maybe 6  spots? going inside the restaurant is equally is small. with two dinner style bar tops. They have paper menus as you walk in.  I ordered the Steak Burrito while my Fiance ordered the Chicken burrito, we got a bottle of water and a bottle of Coke, before we were fully seated the waitress had chips and salsa waiting for us. a few seconds later the burritos showed up, SUPER FAST! the chips were very good. the Salsa's were good too! The Burrito's were just the right size, and tasted great, they also serve the bottle of Cokes with real Sugar which is awesome. the workers are nice and everything was clean, i'd love to come back if i find myself in this part of Illinois.
This is my favorite Mexican place in town! Steak tacos are to die for! They know me by name and I'm not ashamed :D

My favorite Mexican food. Food, salsa, and chips are all amazing. Price is amazing. If you eat there you can get unlimited chips. Can't find a better Mexican place than this. I wish they would expand and get a bigger place!
The fish tacos are amazing but the cheese in the quesadillas is rubbery. The salsa is really good but the chips that come with it are really thick.

To start they handed us 2 different cans of diet pop Diet Pepsi and Diet Coke both were expired. The Pepsi went out of code a week ago while the coke was April 18th. I notified them And they grabbed another one and handed to me and of course it had the same expiration date. They proceeded to pull all the cans out and found that more than 3/4 of them were expired and instead of taking them out they put them all back in and then handed me one that expired the very day I was there June 11.   Apparently the freshest cans of pop that they had expired that day We all ordered the carnet Asada it was $15 and that included a very large piece of carne Asada steak, rice and beans lettuce with red cabbage in it and A half slice of avacado.  The beans were very good and had some white cheese on them, the rice wasn't so good and had chunks of potato in there and a lot of the rice was hard, Not very pleasing to the pallet. All of our stake seemed a bit salty but it was very lean and I found no gristle. The tortillas or homemade corn and delicious they were piping hot, I mean steaming hot even 10 minutes into the meal they were still steaming hot that was a very nice touch.  Of all the pop is $1.25 a kin I was OK with that I wasn't OK with it being expired, the big hit was my son he ordered a Horshata (cinnamon rice water) for $3. He asked for a refill and was told they didn't have any and was charged another three dollars for another one, I am from Chicago and every single place there in the suburbs you get free refills but not here apparently. Coming from Chicago as such a large metropolitan area I am sometimes suspect when I see the reviews and places in smaller towns, and this place is no exception, it may have four stars with a lot of reviews but for what I am used to this is Meh at best.   I will not return, although the meal was not bad there is no value in it and the food was just mediocre aside from the tortillas.

This is my favorite Mexican food place around. Actually it might my favorite place to eat!  The first time I ate here the line was crazy and the place was crowded (not a very large dining-in area) but the second time I ate here it was not bad at all.  Either way, totally worth a little bit of a wait, and the staff here are very friendly people.

LOVE this place! I'm addicted. I could come here everyday. Everything on the menu is pretty cheap and super affordable. Every time I come, there is a huge line out the door, so be prepared to wait. It is definitely well worth the wait! The place is small too, so be ready to fight someone for a seat.   Here's what I've had: -fish tacos (small but good) -tortas (I've tried carne asada, chorizo, and milanesa) -queso fundido with carne asada (melted cheese - really greasy)  Their tortas are the best! They are only around $5 and it's a pretty large portion. Also, each meal comes with free chips and salsa!!
Wonderful traditional Mexican cuisine.  Ingredients are very fresh with wonderful service for such a small restaurant on campus.  Also fairly priced!

Looks a little shabby on the outside, fantastic authentic food on the inside.  We arrived shortly before lunch and by the time our food arrived the place was full and had a line out the door.  Delish: talk about flavor!  Portions might appear on the smaller side (which threw me off, eyes bigger than stomach issue) but very filling.  I ended up having to bring half of my food home!  For mushroom lovers: try the huitlacoche!  My brother lives in the area - great find broey!  We'll head back to Maize when we head back to IL for a family visit.  Deep friend quesadillas?  Yeah, I said it.  Crazy....
Best Mexican food place in champaign. Everyone needs to eat here!! Seriously!! Their tacos are bomb.

In Champaign-Urbana on business and stopped in here after reading the glowing Yelp reviews. It's everything you'd want from a Mexican place, provided you're not looking for a full service sit-down restaurant. My chorizo burrito was excellent (the tortilla alone was incredible!) and I also tried the fried mushroom quesadilla, which was positively dreamy. It's greasy street food, but that's exactly what you want sometimes, and the flavors are authentic. As for service, it's speedy and accommodating -- the place was packed when I realized I'd forgotten to ask for my receipt. I'd placed my order a half hour earlier, yet the employee cheerfully created a new receipt for me... accurately, from memory no less, in the midst of a huge back-up at the counter. From now on, I'll never miss an opportunity to eat here whenever I come to the area. What a gem!

aaaaahhh-MAIZE-ing!!! And, no... this place is not over-hyped! This little taco shack on the corner of Green & 1st is life changing. Friendly staff that serve up fresh, hot, flavorful food with smiles! Yes, it is tiny and cramped (bar seating for less than 15 people). Yes, the parking lot sucks. Yes, there are times where the line is out the door and around the building. But it is all worth it!!   I'd highly recommend the Volcanes. Grilled cheese taco with your choice of meat... It's like a quesadilla and taco had a tasty love baby. Yummy! I really enjoyed the carne asada, pastor and chorizo. The chips and salsa were delicious, too!   Btw... just found out that they are opening a second location this summer on Chestnut where Luna used to be!  Peace, love & tacos!
this place is off the hook, its super cheap and the food is awsome. theres definatly no room inside so probably best to carry out
Really good Mexican restaurant. It is always packed. The food is really authentic. The menu is small but it has a lot of stuff to try out. You can't go wrong with this place.

This is the corner where business comes to die, but I hope this one makes it.   As soon as the pedestrian white walls of Ye Olde Donut & BBQ and, more recently, the late Derald's Diner were washed in the much richer brick red paint, the folks across the street at El Charro got off their asses and re-painted their "Tortas - Tacos - Burritos" signs. American capitalism at work.  Seating is limited at Maize and there are no public bathrooms. It is counter service with about ten barstools.

I have dined at Maize's new location on Chestnut Street and have ordered take-out at their Green Street location. I would definitely recommend dining in at the Chestnut Street location, as the food is much better fresh and the experience is all the better! They have much more dining room on Chestnut Street as well!  Their housemade chips and guacamole is delicious, and their tacos are some of the very best in Champaign-Urbana! I would strongly recommend their fish tacos. They never disappoint and everything on the menu is great!
I decided to try this place to see what the long lines and hype are all about. Maybe I chose the wrong item, but I thought the food was mediocre. It was definitely spicy, that's for sure.

This place is terrible. Coming from southern CA, this does not make the cut for good mexican food. They also make most of their food with lard and don't have any opt out option for vegetarians. Even their chips are smothered in it. Their burrito tasted like a bland hamburger. AND there was a line out the door, I just couldn't believe all these people thought this was good.

Five stars for that guacamole and horchata. Maize is seriously good. Don't expect a great dine-in experience, the place is the size of a shoebox. But anything on their menu is awesome. It's not hard to please college students, and Maize could certainly get by with lower quality food being so close to campus town. Yet and still, they provide authentic Mexican cuisine at great prices.

Maize is a fine addition to the Champaign-Urbana Mexican landscape and is instantly up there with Mas Amigos and El Charro.    Located right across the street from the latter, Maize is another fantastic hole-in-the-wall shop offering mostly authentic Mexican fare.  On the menu: Tlacoyos, Sopes and Huaraches, authentic dishes you will be hard-pressed to find at any other Mexican restaurant in the area.  While we were waiting for our food, other customers raved about the fried quesadillas, another unique menu item.    This was our first visit, so my girlfriend and I each went for some tacos.  Another reviewer mentioned the "home-made tortillas."  Though we didn't ask, the corn tortillas used for our tacos seemed soft, fresh, and thicker than most.  I had tacos al pastor (with cilantro and onions, of course), and I have to admit that they were the best "al pastor" in the C-U area, just a notch above the also excellent versions from Mas Amigos and El Charro.  We also tried the rib eye tacos which were a bit more expensive, but well worth the price with thin slices of tender, well-seasoned steak.    Complimentary chips (with Maize's two unique salsas) were included in our carry-out bag and were pretty good but nothing to write home about.    Overall it was a really nice place to stop for lunch.  We got chips, 3 tacos each, and a couple of drinks for about $15.  Plus, the man taking orders was extremely friendly, explaining any items for us and chatting up the other customers dining at the counter.  We will most definitely be back.

Food is tasty, service is great but the seating capacity and parking need to be addressed.   I'm surprised this place hasn't expanded b/c they do have great food. But the dining feels like i'm eating in a packed standing elevator. If you choose to dine in, try to go before peak hours or after.  The price is a bit expensive but worth the money.

Have eaten at Maize several times.  GREAT food, very good prices, ambiance is crowded and very informal.  This is the place to go for GREAT food, and the basic amenities likely help keep the costs low.  It is typically crowded - the limited counter seating is a constraint.  The building looks like it was converted from a gas station to a restaurant, but no matter - the food is GREAT.  Try it, you'll be glad you did.

This place is great. The food is excellent arguably best fish tacos in town in the traditional minimalist protein-onions-cilantro sort of way. Menu is a-la-carte style so they don't have "meals" like other places (pro or con depending on personal preference). If you have a large group, do take out. Seating is very limited inside (Maybe 15 seats).

Inexpensive, fast service, and delicious authentic Mexican food! I got the mixed burrito with chicken and chorizo which was excellent. Each meal comes with free nachos and salsa also! I would recommend to get some extra hot sauce.

Amazing New Mexican Restaurant!  I hadn't heard about Maize, just saw it pop up on First and Green where during my 4 years here on campus I've seen many establishments come and simply disappear. Me and my roommate (all mexican) went to try it highly suspicious that any place around here could actually offer authentic mexican cuisine. Boy were we wrong. This place is great! It does everything right, taco, quesadillas, huaraches, and even tortas. It's the level of authenticity you might expect from a place like Nuevo Leon. I wish they just had more seating and were able to offer a dinner type atmosphere and menu. Great lunch and cheap dinner food. They are missing a lot of dinner items such as  enchiladas, mole, or pozole. However, everything they do do, they do it right. Their salsas are great, their tortillas delicious. Everything has the perfect amount of grease. Seasoning could be better, but it's better that they under salt than over salt. . Definitely try this place out!

My queso was literally a bag of shredded mozzarella cheese (like Sargento at the grocery store) poured in a skillet and put in the oven. Fish tacos were basically fried cat food. I kept checking to see if they were even fish. My friend got a burrito which was about 40% sour cream and 40% lettuce. The chips and salsa that came with it were fine.  The interior of the restaurant is really small and there is limited seating. Parking is not great, it's hard to get out of the parking lot.

This tiny little joint is worth it. Probably the best tasting Mexican food I've ever had in my life. And that includes Mexican food I've had all over the world, all over the United States, and all over greater Chicagoland.   This isn't necessarily the fanciest joint. And that is an understatement. There's only countertops, no tables. Maybe only 15 stools in the whole place. I took my girlfriend and my kids there, and we were able to find a place to sit together. Watching the place for a good 45 minutes, almost all their sales appeared to be carry out.  But again, let me emphasize the food. It was immaculate. Joy in the mouth. The most wonderful tasting goodness I've had. And I'm not exaggerating. I had a chicken gordita, and a beef gordita, and then some stuff that my daughters ordered. Each thing I tasted was better than the next. I will be eating here every possible chance that I can. I hope that my son continues to flunk his classes at the University of Illinois so I can spend years of joy at this place of hospitality and food nirvana.

Move over, Rick Bayless! This is some of the best Mexican food I have tried in a long time. I've had Maize bookmarked for quite some time, but I never managed to make my way that far down Green Street to check it out. My brother graduated from UIUC last weekend and I knew it was my last chance to try it! It was about a half mile walk to Maize from Alma Mater. We took one look at those long graduation day lines and decided we would much rather enjoy some Mexican food.   There was a crowd of people waiting outside when we arrived and at first I thought that was because all of these people were waiting in line to order. Once I stepped inside, I saw it was because the place was so tiny and there wasn't any room for people to stand around waiting. The actual line to wait for ordering was quite short. Luckily, it seems like a lot of people choose to order carry-out and with good reason. The whole place probably doesn't seat more than 12 and the seating is just countertop. We originally also chose carry-out, but then we were lucky enough to snag some seats, so we decided to dine in.   I ordered the biggest guacamole, which was $7. I also ordered a Vulcane, which was less than $3. Say what? I know the general idea is to eat 2-3 of these little tortillas for a full meal, but I was planning on loading up on chips and guac. The guac = OMG. There was so much! I shared with our group of three and there was still enough leftover to enjoy later in the day. The Vulcane was my favorite, though. It has amazing cheese melted with a toasty crunch to it so you can't fold it up to eat. There was also Spanish rice, onion, shredded lettuce, and avocado. I totally inhaled it.   I was tempted to give Maize four stars because of the cramped space, but I just can't do that. Maize is more about the amazing food than having a relaxing sit-down meal. I strongly recommend you try Maize if you're in the area!

Fresh and authentic Mexican with some nice vegetarian options. Their new location is great - but usually packed for lunch, so give yourself plenty of time! If there were more varied vegetarian options, I've give this 5+ stars. Unfortunately, rice and beans make up the bulk of their veggie options, although there is a potato flautas dish as well as a veggie fajita option.

First, Maize is very good in the authentic Mexican taqueria tradition. They have a number of grilled or fried items from which to choose, as well as  a couple of good sides like guacamole. On each item, you can choose from the following meats: carne asada, chicken, chorizo, or pastor. My favorite is the flavorful pastor (marinated roast pork). Common co-toppings include a wonderful fresh, salty cheese, salsa fresca, sour cream, and cilantro. A variety of salsa comes with, and each bite of every item is delicious, with or without the salsa, which is very good.   Tacos, burritos, tostadas, tortas, tlacoyos, challupas, quesadillas, gorditas, flautas, and huarches are all available. Honestly, they are variations on a theme, rather than distinctively different. Choose your texture. I'm an especially big fan of the tlacoyos (stuff served on top of a piece of grilled chewy flat bread -- you can get the bread fried, but grilled is better). Some of the items do offer interesting add-ons. For example, you can add pumpkin flowers or or mushrooms to the quesadillas.  Maize is located in a small converted space, with just a few seats around the main counter and a counter that runs immediately behind along the back wall. Seats are counter stools. At busy times, customers who are waiting for food get packed in too, or wait outside. The parking lot is equally small. We prefer to get our food to go, and it is always well worth the trip. Prices are inexpensive for the quality -- an excellent value.

Great food!   We had to wait a little bit for a table, but definitely worth it. Our waitress was busy but attentive.   I was disappointed they didn't have sangria, but the Paloma was a delicious drink.   Food was excellent. Salsas were flavorful and spicy. We had the quest as well which was delicious. I really enjoyed my fajitas, and had enough for left overs.   Great meal. Highly recommended.

OK, I was suspicious that Maize was writing their own reviews, but after a Friday evening visit in October, 2011, I now understand why their growing but new fan base is over-the-top loyal and giddy about the joint.  The atmosphere was intimate, the parking lot was packed, there were no available stools.  We overheard a customer who had been there before gushing to his friends about what to order.  So I get the impression this is one of those start-ups that folks feel strongly about supporting and want to see succeed. Me too. Small portions, but very reasonably priced (most things under $3).  Spend $8 and you will have a full meal.  The free chips are unique because they have dark specks in them and seem drier and crunchier than other Mexican restaurants in this genre. The free salsa is excellent.

If you're in the mood for a burrito but want something more authentic (and less crowded) than Chipotle, Maize is a great choice. My favorite meat is the pastor -- it's got a lot of flavor, and it meshes well with the rest of the ingredients in the burrito. The homemade tortilla chips are good too, though not quite salty enough for my tastes. The red salsa that comes in the takeout bag isn't that good, but the other salsa you get if you dine in is better. Speaking of dining in, don't. There are a total of about 15 seats, and they're so tightly packed together that just getting to one is difficult if you aren't 2D. Just get your food to go and save yourself the trouble.

A staple for students and locals here. BF took me here for Sunday brunch with me complaining the whole way about not wanting to eat "heavy" foods this morning after our morning workout. Came in and was astonished by the size of this place - it was TINY. Windows let in a good amount of light, and perhaps the design of the building and the interior layout play a part in the taste of food - theres definitely truth in the opinion that dining in tastes better than eating to go. It's like eating in a little red hut, with tables concentrically placed around the kitchen such that you feel like everyone is eating together, and the staff, atmosphere, and smell of the place makes you know that you're getting extremely fresh food. Be warned, the complimentary nachos and salsa rack are OILY and crispy, but that's because they LITERALLY JUST FRIED THEM. All nachos are made of fried tortilla, so the reason why Maize's nachos are oily is a testament to their freshness (and they are also extra crunchy as a result!). Original steak tacos are $3.95 a piece, and are extremely authentic (think Mexico City), and served on fresh corn tortillas with generous amounts of really flavorful chopped steak seasoned with cilantro, onion, and lime. We also got the chicken flautas, which came with a side of freshly made guac (wonderful lime flavor and not too salty!), rice, salsa, refried beans, and generous amounts of cheese and sour cream. You can tell they use only the amount of oil they need, and don't overdose on oil/butter/cream, resulting in food that was surprisingly light but filling for the amount (could it be contribution of the lime? D:). By the end, both of us were stuffed, but surprisingly not uncomfortable - which has gotta be a first for eating at a mexican restaurant! If you can, eat here (don't take out) - trust me, the food will taste better, fresher, and you'll get the nachos and yummy salsas :)  update: went again and ordered more tacos and their sope (with rice and beans on the side this time) after eating at El Charro and was blown away by how fresh this place is. still 5 stars. Never have a problem with the seating and waiting at this place, maybe Im just lucky?

Tasty tasty tacos& burritos but expensive/unreasonable guac. Fish tacos or fish burrito with cilantro& onions are highly recommended. They stuff lettuce on the bottom of the small guacamole !!!  Best burritos &Tacos in town but get your horchata/guacamole from El toro on Neil st.
it was super tasty and got to try something different while driving thru town. Staff was friendly and helpful with the menu.

Went today for lunch. Tried to be there to beat the rush and grab a seat. Ordered my food and within five minutes, my chicken burrito came out perfectly. It was one of the better burritos I've had. Staff was good too.
A-Maize-ing. Best burrito in town. Friendly service. Fun, quaint dining. Fantastic prices.
Excellent food. Restaurant is a bit small and it was very crowded. Try the chips and salsa and the carne asada plate, you won't be disappointed!

Incredible authentic Mexican food, arguably the best in the area. The al pastor meat is unbelievable and easily my go-to. If I'm at Maize, I usually order a sope and torta, which will more than fill me up but I have a hard time choosing just one. The queso fundido is great too but it is excessively cheesy (may or may not be a good or bad thing) and you HAVE to eat it immediately, otherwise it solidifies too much and becomes a chore to consume. Literally all of the other items are great too, you really cannot go wrong here. It's essentially impossible and uncomfortable to dine in this location, so I would take it to go.

Fantastic service in such a small but cozy diner-esque place.  The food was really good, with soft corn tortillas a fresh ingredients.  If you dine in, they also provide fresh homemade salsas and chips.  Food was just a tad underseasoned for me but the fast and friendly yet unobtrusive service definitely more than made up for it.  Check them out!
Best mexican food around champaign. Not overpriced and they give you chips for takeout as well

freshly made tortilla chips and some literally smokin' freshly off the stove good habanero salsa when you order.    the space is mostly bar counter service, and shoulder to shoulder.  I came right after noon and it was a constant flow of traffic and to go orders.   seems like everyone who had takeaway orders received chips as well.  orders arrive quickly and the staff is ever so kind and helpful.   food was good and tasteful, though my steak burrito was a little lacking in beef.  not the best i had, but its ok.    also had al pastor which was much better on a fried tortilla.    I'd go back when I'm around again.  well deserving of being best mexican cuisine in CU

The food here is outstanding for the price. Food is always prepared in a timely fashion and the quality is consistent. The menu has a variety of options.   The only complaint I've had was the line being too long.

The food is really fresh and delicious, but you'll find yourself bumping elbows with your neighbor a lot if you get caught in one of their periodic mealtime rushes. Their kitchen is larger than their dining area. There is also no bike parking here at all, but even that cannot dissuade me from repeatedly patronizing the best Mexican restaurant in town. They are vegetarian-friendly! Try their delicious corn smut!   Maize, if you are reading this: Get some bike parking! Seriously.

3 stars at best. There is always a line, so I was really excited to try this place. Having just returned from Southern California, where they do Mexican food very well, I had heard good things and I had hopes. I got the carne asada burrito, kind of pricy, and it was just fine. Only fine. I felt three quarters of it was lettuce. It was good sized and I took the rest of it home. I smothered it with cheese and extra salsa and sour cream after reheating and it was much better the second time around. I probably won't be returning any time soon.

Maize offers good tex-mex food for the central Illinois area. The service is above average and they try to be as fast as possible. Yes, the space is fairly cramped, but serving up food in such a small spaces saves money and they pass on the savings to the customers.  That said, I think Maize is fairly overrated. The food is typically pretty bland.
Best. Food. In C-U.  I realize that the bar is very low, indeed, but this place ROCKS. You will not believe how delicious it is, or how cheap. Go here now.
Great prices, great speed, and the food is authentic and fresh.  Its a teeny tiny place on Green street, really for a togo order.

Maize always meets my expectations. The staff and food are always great. You can tell they care about their customers and food. Always fresh ingredients. Even though the space is tight, the food and service are great.

Seriously the best mexican food I've ever had. And I've had a TON of authentic mexican, in America and beyond. All you need to know is that this place is legitimately the best mexican food you will ever eat. Personal favorite is steak tacos. UNREAL people. I can't say enough about how much I love Maize!!!!

Yelp helped me find this place and it was delicious! I had the carne asada and managed to clean my plate. Best Mexican food I have had since leaving Texas. Dining inside was tiny but there was seating available when I got there. Super clean which always makes me happy.

Disappointed in the Mexican food choices in Champaign? El Sombrero, Dos Unrealness, fiesta of mexico!?. You should be disappointed because the food is mostly just reheated.  Ready to level up? Enter Maize. All ingredients are fresh and made on the spot. Seriously you can see the tortilla making presses in the back.
